text: Mohamed Mijarul Quayes (; 2 April 1960 - 11 March 2017) was a Bangladeshi diplomat. He served as Bangladesh's Ambassador to Brazil from 2014 until his death. He was the Bangladesh High Commissioner to the Court of St James's, United Kingdom from 2009 to 2014. Quayes was taken to a Bras√≠lia hospital in February 2017. He later died from multiple organ failure on 11 March. He was 56. ==References== Category:1960 births Category:2017 deaths Category:People from Dhaka Division Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Asian diplomats Category:Disease-related deaths in Brazil
title: Mohamed Mijarul Quayes
